newsitem.title: YEMEN: Yemen deports more than 18,000 foreigners.
newsitem.headline: Yemen deports more than 18,000 foreigners.

text.p: Yemen has deported more than 18,000 illegal aliens since it launched a crackdown on unlawful immigration in August 1995, Yemen's Interior Minister said in remarks published on Sunday.
"We are still following up on violators," Hussein Mohammad Arab told the official al-Thawra newspaper. "Anyone who enters Yemen has to respect the law and his entry has to be legal."
Yemen's crackdown on illegal residents mostly taregeted Somalis, Eritreans and Ethiopians. Officials say it has helped reduce crime.
Officials say many of the illegal foreigners had come to Yemen in the period between 1990, when North and South Yemen merged, and during the civil war of 1994.
